snippet: Willie L. Brown Jr., the all-dominant Speaker of the California Assembly for 15 years, installed his own successor today in Sacramento before heading off to his hometown, San Francisco, to run for mayor.   In a stunning farewell display of politic...
lead_paragraph: Willie L. Brown Jr., the all-dominant Speaker of the California Assembly for 15 years, installed his own successor today in Sacramento before heading off to his hometown, San Francisco, to run for mayor. In a stunning farewell display of political power, Mr. Brown, a Democrat, not only chose his own successor but in so doing chose someone from the other party and the other sex and the most obscure back bench.

headline.main: California Speaker Frustrates G.O.P. One Last Time
